babble.net

Interface Protocol<R extends Request,P extends Response>

  • Type Parameters:
    R - type of Request accepted in this protocol
    P - type of Response generated in this protocol
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    HttpProtocol

    public interface Protocol<R extends Request,P extends Response>
    A communication protocol with asynchronous Request and Response. A protocol creates concrete types of Request and Response that can read and write byte data according to protocol grammar such as HTTP or JSON-RPC.
    Author:
    pinaki poddar

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getName()
      Gets a name for this protocol.
      P newErrorResponse(R request, Exception ex)
      Error response is generated when request processing fails.
      R newRequest()
      Creates an instance of a protocol-specific request object type.
      P newResponse(R request)
      Creates an instance of a protocol-specific response object from given request.
      Router<R,P> newRouter(NioServer<R,P> server)
      A protocol uses a router to match request to a route.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Gets a name for this protocol. Protocol name appears in url of server using this protocol.
        Returns:
        a non-null protocol name e.g. "http".

      • newRouter

        Router<R,P> newRouter(NioServer<R,P> server)
        A protocol uses a router to match request to a route.
        Parameters:
        server - the server that the router would inform when asynchronous response becomes available.
        Returns:
        a router

      • newRequest

        R newRequest()
        Creates an instance of a protocol-specific request object type. The request knows how to parse and validate raw byte data from a network channel.
        Returns:
        a new request

      • newResponse

        P newResponse(R request)
        Creates an instance of a protocol-specific response object from given request. The response knows how to send/format data over a network channel.
        Parameters:
        request - the request that originates a response. Never null.
        Returns:
        response a new response.

      • newErrorResponse

        P newErrorResponse(R request,
                   Exception ex)
        Error response is generated when request processing fails. Error response is like normal response except it may produce a protocol-specific error details (e.g. stack trace or HTTP status code) The error response is written on the same network channel.
        Parameters:
        request - the request that caused the exception. Can be null.
        ex - the exception raised while processing or reading the request from channel.
        Returns:
        an error response
